title: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: Russian President To Land In New Delhi Soon

content: Hours ahead of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India, Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, has accused the Narendra Modi government of discouraging visiting foreign leaders from meeting leaders of the Opposition

title: Probe Agency Attaches Rs 264-Crore Assets Of Realty Firm In Laundering Case

title: Hundreds Of Ambulances Off The Road In Assam Due To Strike By Drivers
content: The emergency medical response ambulance service of the Assam government has come to a standstill with nearly 800 ambulances remaining off the road due to an indefinite strike by the drivers.

title: Odisha Man Sets Mother On Fire For Denying Money To Buy Liquor: Cops
content: An elderly woman suffered severe burn injuries after she was allegedly assaulted and set on fire by her son in Odisha's Bhadrak district, police said on Thursday. The incident took place at Galaganda village within Tihidi police limits.

title: Kerala local body polls: A battle for legacy, relevance, and political survival in Kottayam
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Moscow callback: When Modi first met Putin; photos from 2001 go viral
content: As President Putin prepares for a visit to India, old images of him with Prime Minister Modi from 2001 have resurfaced. Then Gujarat Chief Minister Modi accompanied PM Vajpayee to Moscow, marking his first international engagement and early diplomatic interaction with Putin. The visit fostered cooperation between Gujarat and Russia's Astrakhan region.

title: Bomb threat to nuclear plant: Search ops launched; email mentions Putin visit
content: Security agencies launched an extensive search operation in Ajmer, Rajasthan, following a bomb threat email claiming RDX-based explosives were planted at the Ajmer Sharif dargah, district collectorate, and Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant. The email warned of detonation coinciding with Russian President Vladimir Putin's arrival. Premises were evacuated and thoroughly checked, with no suspicious objects found so far.

title: Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal passes away; PM condoles death
content: Swaraj Kaushal, former Mizoram Governor and husband of the late Sushma Swaraj, passed away at 73 after a brief illness. He was a senior advocate with a distinguished public and legal career. His daughter, MP Bansuri Swaraj, expressed profound grief, finding solace in his reunion with her mother. Leaders mourned his contributions.

title: New gratuity rules: How will your payout increase at various salary levels? Explained
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, broaden the definition of 'wages,' potentially increasing gratuity payouts for employees. Fixed-term employees now qualify for gratuity after one year of service. Employers face increased financial liabilities, with clarity needed on past service calculations.

title: $100 billion erased: Salesforce CEO reassures investors on AI fears
content: Salesforce reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst expectations and offering a boost to CEO Marc Benioff amidst investor concerns about AI profitability. Despite a recent market value drop, the company's AI agent strategy, including layoffs, aims for significant future revenue. Benioff remains optimistic about customer adoption and long-term growth targets.

title: 'Agar Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma ka dimaag ... ': Ravi Shastri's bold warning
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma against doubts about their ODI future. He emphasised that players of their stature should not be questioned, stating that if they perform, their critics will quickly fade away. Shastri's remarks come amid discussions about India's long-term team planning for the 2027 World Cup.

title: Rupee rebounds: RBI support, softer dollar offer relief; currency now 89.96 vs $
content: The rupee recovered from its record low, closing at 89.96 against the US dollar after a softer dollar index and reported RBI intervention. Despite initial weakness due to foreign selling and trade deal delays, the currency found support. Analysts anticipate continued pressure from outflows but potential cushioning from a subdued dollar and possible RBI actions.

title: 'No one had more skin than me': Root's century big relief for Hayden; here's why
content: Joe Root finally ended his long wait for a Test century in Australia, reaching the milestone at the Gabba. This achievement brought relief to former Australian opener Matthew Hayden, who had publicly vowed to "walk nude around the MCG" if Root failed to score a hundred on the tour. Root reached the milestone in 181 balls.

title: AI rivalry heats up: Anthropic CEO mocks OpenAI and Google ‘Code Red’
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei dismissed rivals' 'code red' emergencies, stating his company's focus on enterprise clients allows for steady development. Unlike competitors, Anthropic prioritizes business needs like coding and intellectual tasks over consumer engagement. This approach, coupled with responsible growth management, positions Anthropic to navigate the competitive AI landscape.

title: 'Up to delegation': Govt counters Rahul's Putin meet claim; BJP piles on
content: Government sources have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims that opposition leaders are barred from meeting foreign dignitaries. They stated that the Ministry of External Affairs facilitates official meetings, while engagements outside this framework are at the visitor's discretion. Several foreign leaders have met Gandhi since he became Leader of the Opposition, including Prime Ministers from Bangladesh, Malaysia, Mauritius, and New Zealand.

title: Ashes: Joe Root ends century drought, scores first-ever hundred in Australia
content: Root reached the milestone in 181 balls, batting through a phase when England needed stability and control, and in the process, checked off one of the few achievements missing from his record.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife cut her Amazon stake to donate millions of dollars
content: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

title: From Rs 43K tickets to 10-hr delays: Flight disruptions continue - key points
content: IndiGo faces a nationwide operational crisis with widespread flight cancellations and delays, leaving lakhs of passengers stranded and sparking anger. The DGCA has summoned the airline's management to explain the "unprecedented disruptions" and present a plan to stabilize operations during the peak travel season.

title: Putin-Modi meet: How India became Russia’s lifeline - but on its own terms
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in New Delhi for a crucial summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking to bolster energy and arms ties amidst Western sanctions. India navigates a diplomatic tightrope, balancing its historical partnership with Moscow against growing ties with Washington, aiming for strategic autonomy.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices dipped on Thursday amid mixed global trends and weak US economic data, while silver futures saw gains. Investors are cautiously awaiting key US inflation data for clarity on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy. Geopolitical tensions also contributed to a risk premium for precious metals.

title: Cardi B shares sweet glimpse of newborn son, calls him her ‘cuddle buddy’
content: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Warriors linked to $27M Mavericks star as support for Curry; Hield seen as key asset
content: Golden State Warriors and Dallas Mavericks are reportedly considering a straightforward trade: Buddy Hield for Naji Marshall. This move addresses roster imbalances, with the Warriors seeking defensive wing depth and the Mavericks aiming to boost floor spacing around their stars. Both teams could benefit from a fresh start and improved team dynamics.

title: MLB trade rumors: Cubs poised to land $400M Tigers Cy Young winner in mega deal
content: The Chicago Cubs are reportedly considering a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner, to fill the void left by Kyle Tucker's expected free agency departure. This move would create a formidable pitching duo with rookie Cade Horton and signal a serious World Series push for the Cubs.

title: 'Where is Shami? Why isn't he playing?': Harbhajan fumes after India's defeat
content: Harbhajan Singh urges India to win without Jasprit Bumrah after South Africa's historic 359 chase. He suggests recalling Varun Chakaravarthy to the ODI squad, emphasizing the need for match-winners in shorter formats. The series is now tied 1-1 heading into the decider.

title: 'Govt doesn't want us to meet': Rahul's big charge amid Putin's India visit; Tharoor agrees
content: Hours before Russia President Putin's arrival, Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government for breaking the tradition of allowing the Leader of Opposition to meet foreign dignitaries. He stated this practice, observed under Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh, is now ignored due to government insecurity. Putin's visit will focus on trade, technology, and regional issues, with several agreements expected.

title: 'Targeted kids better looking than hers': Scary confessions of 'serial killer' mom
content: A chilling child murder spree has been uncovered in Haryana, with a 34-year-old woman, Poonam, confessing to drowning at least four children, including her own toddler son. Driven by an urge to kill children more attractive than her own, she meticulously staged the deaths as accidents. The latest victim was a six-year-old girl at a wedding.

title: 180 aboard: Amid nationwide disruptions, IndiGo flight gets bomb threat
content: An Indigo flight from Madina to Hyderabad made an emergency landing in Ahmedabad due to a suspected bomb threat. This incident occurs amidst widespread flight disruptions and cancellations by IndiGo, attributed to pilot shortages and new crew-duty rules, leading to passenger distress and surging fares.

title: Watch: BJP fields ‘Sonia Gandhi’ in Kerala's local body polls; sparks buzz in Munnar
content: A local election in Munnar has taken an ironic turn as the BJP fields Sonia Gandhi, named after the Congress stalwart, against the official Congress candidate. The BJP nominee, daughter of a devoted Congressman, presents a unique challenge for her opponents. This unusual situation is sparking debate, potentially swaying voters and reshaping the local political landscape.

title: IND vs SA: Early SMAT exit for Hardik Pandya! Set to join India T20I squad in Cuttack
content: Hardik Pandya has completed his domestic warm-up and will join the Indian squad in Cuttack on December 6 for the T20I series against South Africa. After recovering from injury, Pandya showed promising form with both bat and ball in two Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy matches.

title: Ashes: Starc rewrites history! Surpasses Akram as most successful left-arm Test pacer
content: Mitchell Starc has become the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test cricket, surpassing Wasim Akram's record of 414 wickets. The Australian achieved this milestone at the Gabba, his debut venue, in his 102nd Test. Starc's early wickets provided Australia with a strong start in the Ashes Test, despite England's recovery.

title: 'Obligated to provide': SC tells states to deploy more staff for SIR; TVK plea flags BLO plight
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed state governments to provide additional staff to reduce the workload of Booth Level Officers (BLOs) involved in EC's SIR exercise. This comes amid reports of excessive pressure and alleged suicides, with the court emphasising case-by-case consideration for exemption requests and ensuring adequate workforce. The direction was issued after TVK's plea flagging BLO plight.

title: 10 foods that boost liver health, reduce fat and improve function
content: Nourishing your liver is crucial for overall health, and diet plays a significant role. This article explores ten scientifically backed foods, including coffee, green tea, and fatty fish, that can help reduce inflammation, protect against fat accumulation, and improve liver enzymes. Incorporating these nutrient-dense options supports the liver's vital functions.

title: ‘Cartel-like behaviour’: FIP issues letter flagging IndiGo’s ‘hiring freeze’
content: Indian pilots' body accuses IndiGo of a hiring freeze and poor planning, leading to flight cancellations and delays. Despite a two-year window for new flight duty rules, the airline allegedly failed to adequately staff operations. The Federation of Indian Pilots urges the DGCA to reallocate IndiGo's slots if commitments to passengers remain unmet due to avoidable shortages.

title: IND vs SA: 'When did Siraj become a one-format player?' - Ex-cricketer slams India's selection
content: Former India opener Aakash Chopra has expressed bewilderment over Mohammed Siraj's exclusion from the ODI setup. He questioned the decision, highlighting Siraj's strong ODI record and contrasting it with the struggles of other young pacers who were preferred. Chopra finds it inexplicable that Siraj has seemingly become a red-ball specialist.

title: Gurgaon hit-&-run: Bizman mowed down by speeding car while cycling; CCTV footage emerges
content: A 58-year-old cyclist was fatally struck by a car in Gurgaon's DLF 2. The hit-and-run incident occurred during his routine morning ride, with CCTV footage identifying the vehicle. Police are actively tracing the owner for arrest, while the community raises concerns about road safety within residential areas.

title: IND vs SA: Heartbreak! When was the last time India lost an ODI despite a Kohli century?
content: A rare defeat for India saw Virat Kohli's brilliant century go in vain as South Africa chased down 358 to level the ODI series. This marked the first loss in nearly seven years despite a Kohli ton, highlighting an unusual outcome.  Aiden Markram's century also played a crucial role in the visitors' successful chase.

title: Putin’s India visit: Private dinner with PM Modi, Rajghat visit — what’s on itinerary
content: President Vladimir Putin arrives in India for a significant visit. He will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi for private dinner diplomacy. Day two includes a Rajghat tribute and summit talks. Discussions will focus on strengthening economic ties, trade, and cooperation in technology and energy. Several bilateral agreements are expected to be signed, charting a roadmap for future collaboration until 2030.

title: Bengaluru techie's death note: How 'dream house' became trap for software professional
content: A Bengaluru techie tragically ended his life, citing relentless harassment from neighbours and civic officials over a Rs 20 lakh demand. Murali Govindaraju was found dead in his under-construction home, leaving a note detailing his torment. His neighbours have been arrested, accused of extorting money under the guise of activism, leading to this devastating outcome.

title: IND vs SA: ‘People who haven't achieved much are deciding Ro-Ko's future': Harbhajan slams critics
content: Former spinner Harbhajan Singh passionately defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, questioning the authority of less accomplished individuals to dictate their future. He highlighted their current strong performances, emphasising they are setting benchmarks for younger players and deserve to be considered for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Harbhajan also advocated for better Test pitches in India.

title: Rupee touches 90! Get ready to pay higher for consumer goods; what may become costlier
content: A depreciating rupee beyond Rs 90 against the US dollar is poised to trigger price hikes across consumer electronics, beauty products, and automobiles. This could negate recent GST rate cut benefits, impacting sales momentum. Manufacturers are planning 3-10% increases from December-January to offset rising import costs.

title: TNUSRB SI admit card 2025 released: Direct link to download hall tickets
content: The Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board has released the hall tickets for the 2025 Sub-Inspector recruitment, with candidates required to download them from tnusrb.tn.gov.in. The Main Written Exam and Tamil Language Eligibility Test will be held on December 21 across 46 centres. TNUSRB has activated multiple helplines for support and issued strict exam-day guidelines, including a complete ban on electronic devices.

title: 'Will build Babri' remark: TMC suspends Humayun Kabir; MLA had warned to block highway
content: Trinamool Congress suspended MLA Humayun Kabir for planning a mosque foundation ceremony modelled on the Babri Masjid on December 6, despite party warnings and Raj Bhawan's concerns. Kabir defied the party and Governor, vowing to proceed and warning of highway blockades if stopped, escalating tensions in Murshidabad.

title: At 19.7%, IndiGo on time performance rock-bottomed on Wednesday
content: IndiGo flights faced massive disruptions, with only 19.7% operating on time Wednesday, leading to hundreds of cancellations. This crisis is linked to new pilot duty norms and questions are raised about the airline's preparedness and regulatory oversight. IndiGo has cut flights for 48 hours to stabilize operations, offering passengers refunds or alternatives.

title: Driving on highways? Jio will now send safety warnings to your phone: Details
content: Jio users on Indian highways will soon receive real-time safety alerts on their phones, a result of a new partnership with NHAI. This telecom-based warning system will notify travellers of hazards like accident-prone zones and diversions via SMS, WhatsApp, and voice calls.

title: ‘Mini-sonic booms’ on Mars: Nasa rover records electric sparks in dust devils — watch
content: NASA's Perseverance rover has unveiled a captivating phenomenon: tiny electrical sparks, likened to 'mini-lightning', occurring within the Martian dust devils and storms. This crucial discovery not only validates a longstanding scientific hypothesis but also has the potential to revolutionize our comprehension of the Red Planet's atmospheric features and habitability.

title: 'Strategic mistake': IndiGo flight disruptions due to new roster rules? What DGCA norms say
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is facing significant flight disruptions, with hundreds of cancellations and delays due to new pilot rest and duty-hour regulations. Despite a month since implementation, the airline struggles to adapt, leading to a sharp drop in on-time performance. IndiGo cites operational challenges and expects disruptions to continue.

title: Week 15 Anger Index: Biggest slights, snubs and shenanigans
content: the first college football playoff rankings came out five weeks ago . a few teams jockeying up or down a slot, but effectively no seismic shifts in the landscape . the ACC (Louisville to Cal, Virginia to Wake and Georgia Tech to Pitt) is the only two teams projected in the field in the first ranking .

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Liv Morgan takes over
content: the first "Raw" after Survivor Series began a season that will lead us to WrestleMania in April . the identity of the masked man who interfered at the end of the men's WarGames match wasn't close to being uncovered . neither was the next challenger to the women's tag team titles .

title: Rankings for Week 14
content:
Field Yates breaks down Matthew Stafford's fantasy Week 13 performance and outlook against the Cardinals in Week 14. (0:57) ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. title: NCAA women's volleyball tournament: Bold predictions, must-watch players and more
content: all 64 NCAA women's college volleyball tournament teams were finalized Sunday . the undefeated Huskers earned the no. 1 overall seed, led by first-year coach Dani Busboom Kelly . Nebraska has lost only seven sets this season as it is on the hunt to add a sixth national championship title to its résumé .

title: Rating Portugal kit for Ronaldo's final World Cup, other Puma jerseys
content: 42 of the 48 qualifiers confirmed for 2026 world cup draw . a cavalcade of kits will be released in preparation for the event . the event will be staged in Canada, Mexico and the united states next summer .

title: Ja, LaMelo and Trae: Why these All-Star guards may have 'negative value'
content: coach: "you feel like you've got the same joy right now that we used to see? no" rumors that ball, Morant and Young could all be available in the trade deadline . a poll of executives, scouts and coaches conducted by ESPN .

content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day
content: DT Lamar Brown, the no. 1 overall ESPN 300 recruit, explains his decision to not sign yet after verbally committing to LSU earlier this year . college football's early signing period started Wednesday and runs until Friday . if a prospect doesn't sign a national letter of intent by Friday, the next national signing day for this cycle .

title: 'He ain't leaving': Inside George Pickens' breakout season and future in Dallas
content: a.Q. Shipley and darius Butler break down the Dallas Cowboys' successful offense with players like George Pickens . pickens was a second-round pick in 2022 . he's a child, one Steelers source says .

title: 'Not everyone can win': Are CFB's blue bloods really losing their grip on the sport?
content: the Commodores hadn't had a winning season in nine years . he and his staff would scour the country for the best underdeveloped recruits . lea says that he doesn't know a world where the team does not belong . "Vanderbilt football will be the best program in the country," he says .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Week 15 preview: A look at Championship Week matchups and players to watch
content: if the playoff has taken some of the shine off a championship trophy, there will still be plenty of action this weekend with high stakes . in the big 12, BYU hopes to avenge its only loss -- a blowout to Texas Tech -- and steal a playoff bid . the conference's best team -- Miami -- won't take the field .

title: J-Rod's journey: From sleeping on floors and taking out loans to Heisman contention
content: quarterback had just ended his freshman season at Virginia . he had a creeping doubt that maybe it was time to give up his quarterback dreams . "the pat McAfee Show" is slated for the big 12 championship vs. the BYU Cougars .

title: Ranking men's basketball Freshman of the Year contenders: Cameron Boozer pulls away
content: darryn Peterson's return should up the drama of this freshman of the year race . he'll be eligible for a return in 50% or more of his team's games . but he is "very close" to his return, according to coach bill Self .

title: Women's Power Rankings: Texas unseats UConn at No. 1 after big wins
content: the Players Era Championship in Las Vegas last week prompted a new no. 1 in ESPN's Power Rankings . the gamecocks and longhorns met four times in 2024-25: twice in the regular season, in the SEC tournament final and the national semifinals, with South Carolina winning three of the four . it's not the first time South Carolina coach Dawn Staley and Texas coach Vic Schaefer have been part of a rivalry .

title: 🏈 CFP Bubble Watch: Could the ACC get left out?
content: if the ACC beats Virginia, it's not guaranteed a spot in the 12-team field . it could open the door for two conference champions to compete for a national title . at no. 12, the Hurricanes still need some help, but Alabama increased its chances .

title: 'Visible from space': Astronaut shares orbital view of Mecca 400kms above the earth
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Deadly roads: 1.77 lakh killed in crashes in 2024; maximum ever in a year
content: in 2023, road crashes claimed around 1.73 lakh lives . road transport ministry in a written reply to the Lok Sabha shared the number of people killed in road crashes last year . in another reply, the minister informed the house that 54,433 were killed in NHs .
